title: U.S. stock futures resume chase toward record highs as GDP and key tech reports await
text:
Futures on the Dow Jones Industrial Average YM00 rose 87 points, or 0.3%, to 35475

Futures on the S&P 500 ES00 rose 0.3%, or 15 points, to 4559

Futures on the Nasdaq 100 rose 0.6%, or 89 points, to 15676

On Wednesday, the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA fell 266 points, or 0.74%, to 35491, the S&P 500 SPX declined 23 points, or 0.51%, to 4552, and the Nasdaq Composite COMP ended with virtually no change to 15235.84.

Even after the off day, all three major indexes are within 1% of their record highs.

What's driving markets

The initial reading of third-quarter gross domestic product is due at 8:30 a.m. Eastern, with expectations of 2.8% growth.

“!f anything, following yesterday's news of an unexpected sharp widening of the merchandise trade deficit in September, the balance of risks to that estimate appear to lie to the downside, with net exports perhaps subtracting 1 percentage point from growth,” said Emily Nicol, economist at Daiwa Capital Markets Europe.

Caterpillar CAT and Merck MRK each edged higher after third-quarter results, with tech giants Amazon AMZN and Apple AAPL reporting after the close.

Ford Motor Co. F jumped 9% on its fourth-quarter forecast and after resuming its dividend payment.
